revised_title: Observations on the Heat of the Weather in July and September 1749
tldr: The author, Henry Miles, shares his observations on the heat of the weather in July and September 1749. He reports the highest temperature he has ever recorded, 87.5°F, and discusses the lack of rain and hail during a storm. He also compares his thermometer readings to those of Mr. Canton, noting a 17-degree drop in temperature during the storm.
